section_info.title: Introduction: Protecting Cardholder Data with PCI Security Standards

framework_info.framework_name: Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS)
framework_info.framework_description: The Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) is a set of security standards designed to ensure that all companies that accept, process, store or transmit credit card information maintain a secure environment. PCI DSS applies to all entities involved in payment card processing including merchants, processors, acquirers, issuers, and service providers.

policies.policy_description: This policy establishes the requirements for protecting cardholder data throughout its lifecycle. It aims to mitigate risks associated with data breaches and ensure compliance with PCI DSS standards. The policy applies to all personnel involved in payment card transactions and outlines the necessary security measures to safeguard sensitive information.
policies.policy_text: All personnel must adhere to the guidelines set forth in this policy to protect cardholder data. This includes implementing security measures at all points of cardholder data processing, including point-of-sale devices, mobile devices, and web applications. Regular assessments must be conducted to identify vulnerabilities, and any identified risks must be remediated promptly. Compliance with PCI DSS is mandatory for all entities involved in the processing of cardholder data.
policies.scope: This policy applies to all organizational units and personnel involved in payment card processing, including merchants, service providers, and acquirers. It covers all systems, applications, and infrastructure that store, process, or transmit cardholder data, including on-premises, cloud, and remote environments. The policy also encompasses third-party vendors and service providers that handle cardholder data.
policies.objective: The objective of this policy is to ensure the protection of cardholder data by implementing robust security measures, achieving compliance with PCI DSS, and minimizing the risk of data breaches. Specific goals include conducting regular assessments, remediating vulnerabilities, and maintaining documentation for compliance reporting.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy outlines the requirements for assessing and inventorying all locations where cardholder data is stored, processed, or transmitted. It mandates regular reviews to ensure that all assets are accounted for and that vulnerabilities are identified.
subpolicies.control: WHAT: Conduct a comprehensive assessment of all systems that handle cardholder data. WHO: The IT Security Team is responsible for conducting the assessment. WHEN: Assessments must be conducted annually and whenever significant changes occur in the IT environment. HOW: Utilize automated tools and manual reviews to identify all locations of cardholder data. WHERE: This applies to all organizational units and systems that process payment card transactions.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy specifies the procedures for remediating identified vulnerabilities in systems that handle cardholder data. It includes guidelines for securely removing unnecessary data and implementing secure business processes.
subpolicies.control: WHAT: Remediate identified vulnerabilities by applying security patches and removing unnecessary cardholder data. WHO: The IT Security Team and relevant department heads are responsible for remediation efforts. WHEN: Remediation must occur within 30 days of identifying a vulnerability. HOW: Follow established remediation protocols and document all actions taken. WHERE: This applies to all systems and applications that store or process cardholder data.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy outlines the requirements for documenting assessment and remediation activities, as well as submitting compliance reports to relevant stakeholders.
subpolicies.control: WHAT: Document all assessment findings and remediation actions, and prepare compliance reports for submission. WHO: The Compliance Officer is responsible for overseeing documentation and reporting. WHEN: Documentation must be completed within 10 days of assessment and remediation activities. HOW: Use standardized reporting templates and maintain records in a secure location. WHERE: This applies to all departments involved in payment card processing.

policies.policy_title: PCI Data Security Standard Compliance Policy
policies.policy_description: This policy outlines the requirements for compliance with the PCI Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) to protect cardholder data. It is essential for all entities that store, process, or transmit cardholder data to adhere to these standards to mitigate risks associated with data breaches and ensure the security of payment transactions. The policy applies to all personnel involved in payment processing and covers all systems and applications that handle cardholder data.
policies.policy_text: All entities that store, process, or transmit cardholder data must comply with the PCI DSS requirements. This includes implementing security measures to protect cardholder data, conducting regular security assessments, and ensuring that all personnel are trained on PCI compliance. Compliance must be maintained continuously, and any non-compliance must be reported immediately to the compliance officer.
policies.scope: This policy applies to all organizational units, personnel, systems, applications, and infrastructure involved in the storage, processing, or transmission of cardholder data. It covers on-premises, cloud, and remote environments, as well as third-party vendors and service providers that handle cardholder data.
policies.objective: The objective of this policy is to ensure that all entities comply with PCI DSS requirements to protect cardholder data, reduce the risk of data breaches, and maintain the trust of customers and stakeholders. Specific goals include achieving full compliance with PCI DSS, conducting regular training for all relevant personnel, and implementing necessary security measures to safeguard cardholder information.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy outlines the specific measures that must be implemented to protect cardholder data, including encryption, access controls, and secure storage practices.
subpolicies.control: WHAT: Implement encryption for all cardholder data at rest and in transit. WHO: IT Security Team is responsible for encryption implementation. WHEN: Encryption must be applied immediately upon data storage or transmission. HOW: Utilize industry-standard encryption protocols (e.g., AES-256) and ensure regular updates. WHERE: Applies to all systems and applications that store or transmit cardholder data.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy mandates regular security assessments to identify vulnerabilities and ensure compliance with PCI DSS.
subpolicies.control: WHAT: Conduct quarterly security assessments and annual penetration testing. WHO: Compliance Officer and IT Security Team will oversee assessments. WHEN: Assessments must be conducted quarterly, with a comprehensive report submitted annually. HOW: Utilize third-party security firms for penetration testing and internal teams for vulnerability assessments. WHERE: Applies to all systems that handle cardholder data.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy requires training for all personnel involved in payment processing to ensure awareness of PCI DSS requirements and security practices.
subpolicies.control: WHAT: Provide PCI DSS training to all relevant personnel. WHO: HR Department will coordinate training sessions. WHEN: Training must be conducted annually and upon onboarding of new employees. HOW: Utilize online training modules and in-person workshops. WHERE: Applies to all employees and contractors involved in payment processing.

framework_info.framework_name: Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS)
framework_info.framework_description: The Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) is a set of security standards designed to ensure that all companies that accept, process, store or transmit credit card information maintain a secure environment. PCI DSS applies to all entities involved in payment card processing including merchants, processors, acquirers, issuers, and service providers.

policies.policy_description: This policy establishes the requirements for building and maintaining a secure network and systems to protect cardholder data. It is essential for all entities that process, store, or transmit cardholder data to implement these security measures to mitigate risks associated with unauthorized access and data breaches.
policies.policy_text: All entities must install and maintain a firewall configuration to protect cardholder data and must not use vendor-supplied defaults for system passwords and other security parameters. This policy applies to all systems that handle cardholder data and must be reviewed and updated regularly to ensure compliance with PCI DSS requirements.
policies.scope: This policy applies to all organizational units and personnel involved in the processing, storage, or transmission of cardholder data. It covers all systems, applications, and infrastructure that interact with cardholder data, including on-premises, cloud, and remote environments. Third-party vendors and service providers must also adhere to this policy.
policies.objective: The objective of this policy is to establish a secure network environment that protects cardholder data from unauthorized access and breaches. Specific goals include ensuring the implementation of firewalls, restricting default settings, and maintaining compliance with PCI DSS requirements. Measurable outcomes include regular audits and assessments of network security controls.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy outlines the requirements for configuring and maintaining firewalls to protect cardholder data. It includes guidelines for firewall rules, access controls, and regular reviews.
subpolicies.control: WHAT: Configure firewalls to restrict unauthorized access to cardholder data. WHO: Network security team is responsible for implementation. WHEN: Firewalls must be configured upon installation and reviewed quarterly. HOW: Use industry-standard configurations and conduct penetration testing. WHERE: Applies to all network segments that handle cardholder data.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy mandates the prohibition of vendor-supplied defaults for system passwords and other security parameters. It includes guidelines for creating strong passwords and regular updates.
subpolicies.control: WHAT: Change all vendor-supplied default passwords and security parameters. WHO: IT security team is responsible for implementation. WHEN: Default settings must be changed before systems are deployed and reviewed annually. HOW: Implement a password policy that requires complex passwords and regular updates. WHERE: Applies to all systems and applications that process cardholder data.

policies.policy_description: This policy outlines the requirements for protecting cardholder data throughout its lifecycle. It is crucial for ensuring that sensitive information is secured against unauthorized access and breaches.
policies.policy_text: All entities must protect stored cardholder data and encrypt the transmission of cardholder data across open, public networks. This policy applies to all personnel and systems that handle cardholder data and must be enforced to maintain compliance with PCI DSS.
policies.scope: This policy applies to all organizational units and personnel involved in the handling of cardholder data. It encompasses all systems, applications, and infrastructure that store or transmit cardholder data, including third-party vendors and service providers.
policies.objective: The objective of this policy is to ensure the confidentiality and integrity of cardholder data by implementing strong data protection measures. Specific goals include the encryption of data in transit and at rest, as well as regular assessments of data protection controls. Measurable outcomes include compliance audits and incident response readiness.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy specifies the requirements for encrypting cardholder data during transmission and storage. It includes guidelines for encryption algorithms and key management.
subpolicies.control: WHAT: Encrypt cardholder data during transmission across open, public networks and when stored. WHO: IT security team is responsible for implementation. WHEN: Encryption must be applied before data is transmitted or stored and reviewed annually. HOW: Use strong encryption algorithms as per industry standards (e.g., AES-256). WHERE: Applies to all systems that process, store, or transmit cardholder data.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy outlines the requirements for protecting stored cardholder data, including access controls and data retention policies.
subpolicies.control: WHAT: Implement access controls to restrict access to stored cardholder data. WHO: Data protection officer is responsible for implementation. WHEN: Access controls must be established upon data storage and reviewed quarterly. HOW: Use role-based access controls and regularly audit access logs. WHERE: Applies to all databases and storage systems containing cardholder data.

policies.policy_description: This policy establishes the requirements for maintaining a vulnerability management program to protect systems against malware and other threats. It is essential for ensuring the security of systems that handle cardholder data.
policies.policy_text: All entities must protect all systems against malware and regularly update anti-virus software or programs. Additionally, secure systems and applications must be developed and maintained to mitigate vulnerabilities.
policies.scope: This policy applies to all organizational units and personnel responsible for system security and maintenance. It covers all systems, applications, and infrastructure that process cardholder data, including third-party vendors and service providers.
policies.objective: The objective of this policy is to establish a proactive approach to vulnerability management that protects systems from malware and other threats. Specific goals include the regular updating of anti-virus software and the development of secure applications. Measurable outcomes include vulnerability assessments and incident response effectiveness.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy outlines the requirements for protecting systems against malware, including the use of anti-virus software and regular updates.
subpolicies.control: WHAT: Implement and maintain anti-virus software on all systems. WHO: IT security team is responsible for implementation. WHEN: Anti-virus software must be installed before systems are deployed and updated weekly. HOW: Use automated tools for updates and conduct regular scans. WHERE: Applies to all systems that process or store cardholder data.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy mandates the development and maintenance of secure systems and applications to mitigate vulnerabilities.
subpolicies.control: WHAT: Follow secure coding practices and conduct regular security testing. WHO: Development team is responsible for implementation. WHEN: Security practices must be integrated into the development lifecycle and reviewed after each release. HOW: Use automated security testing tools and conduct code reviews. WHERE: Applies to all applications that process cardholder data.

policies.policy_description: This policy establishes the requirements for implementing strong access control measures to protect cardholder data. It is critical for ensuring that only authorized personnel have access to sensitive information.
policies.policy_text: All entities must restrict access to cardholder data by business need to know, identify and authenticate access to system components, and restrict physical access to cardholder data.
policies.scope: This policy applies to all organizational units and personnel with access to cardholder data. It encompasses all systems, applications, and infrastructure that handle cardholder data, including third-party vendors and service providers.
policies.objective: The objective of this policy is to ensure that access to cardholder data is strictly controlled and monitored. Specific goals include implementing role-based access controls and regular audits of access logs. Measurable outcomes include reduced unauthorized access incidents and improved access control compliance.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy outlines the requirements for restricting access to cardholder data based on business need to know.
subpolicies.control: WHAT: Implement role-based access controls to restrict access to cardholder data. WHO: Access control administrator is responsible for implementation. WHEN: Access controls must be established upon user onboarding and reviewed quarterly. HOW: Use access control lists and regularly audit access permissions. WHERE: Applies to all systems that process or store cardholder data.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy mandates the identification and authentication of access to system components.
subpolicies.control: WHAT: Implement multi-factor authentication for all users accessing cardholder data. WHO: IT security team is responsible for implementation. WHEN: Multi-factor authentication must be enforced upon user access and reviewed annually. HOW: Use authentication tokens and biometric verification. WHERE: Applies to all systems that process or store cardholder data.

policies.policy_description: This policy establishes the requirements for regularly monitoring and testing networks to ensure the security of cardholder data. It is essential for identifying vulnerabilities and ensuring compliance with PCI DSS.
policies.policy_text: All entities must track and monitor all access to network resources and cardholder data, and regularly test security systems and processes.
policies.scope: This policy applies to all organizational units and personnel responsible for monitoring and testing network security. It covers all systems, applications, and infrastructure that handle cardholder data, including third-party vendors and service providers.
policies.objective: The objective of this policy is to ensure continuous monitoring and testing of network security to identify vulnerabilities and ensure compliance with PCI DSS. Specific goals include regular security assessments and incident response readiness. Measurable outcomes include timely detection of security incidents and improved security posture.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy outlines the requirements for tracking and monitoring access to network resources and cardholder data.
subpolicies.control: WHAT: Implement logging and monitoring of all access to cardholder data. WHO: IT security team is responsible for implementation. WHEN: Logging must be enabled upon system deployment and reviewed daily. HOW: Use centralized logging solutions and conduct regular log reviews. WHERE: Applies to all systems that process or store cardholder data.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy mandates the regular testing of security systems and processes to identify vulnerabilities.
subpolicies.control: WHAT: Conduct regular security testing, including vulnerability scans and penetration testing. WHO: Security testing team is responsible for implementation. WHEN: Security testing must be conducted quarterly and after significant changes. HOW: Use automated testing tools and manual assessments. WHERE: Applies to all systems that process or store cardholder data.

policies.policy_description: This policy establishes the requirements for maintaining an information security policy that addresses information security for all personnel. It is essential for fostering a culture of security awareness and compliance.
policies.policy_text: All entities must maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel, ensuring that security practices are understood and followed throughout the organization.
policies.scope: This policy applies to all organizational units and personnel within the organization. It encompasses all systems, applications, and infrastructure that handle cardholder data, including third-party vendors and service providers.
policies.objective: The objective of this policy is to promote a culture of security awareness and compliance among all personnel. Specific goals include regular training and awareness programs. Measurable outcomes include improved security practices and reduced incidents of non-compliance.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy outlines the requirements for conducting security awareness training for all personnel.
subpolicies.control: WHAT: Implement security awareness training programs for all employees. WHO: HR and IT security teams are responsible for implementation. WHEN: Training must be conducted upon onboarding and annually thereafter. HOW: Use interactive training modules and assessments. WHERE: Applies to all personnel within the organization.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy mandates the regular review and update of the information security policy to ensure its relevance and effectiveness.
subpolicies.control: WHAT: Review and update the information security policy annually. WHO: Information security officer is responsible for implementation. WHEN: Reviews must be conducted annually and after significant incidents. HOW: Use feedback from audits and assessments to inform updates. WHERE: Applies to all organizational units.

section_info.title: Security Controls and Processes for PCI DSS Requirements

framework_info.framework_name: Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS)
framework_info.framework_description: The Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) is a set of security standards designed to ensure that all companies that accept, process, store or transmit credit card information maintain a secure environment. PCI DSS applies to all entities involved in payment card processing including merchants, processors, acquirers, issuers, and service providers.

policies.policy_description: This policy outlines the security controls and processes necessary for compliance with PCI DSS requirements. It establishes the framework for assessing compliance through qualified assessors and self-assessment tools, ensuring that all entities involved in payment card processing maintain a secure environment. The policy aims to facilitate adherence to PCI DSS standards while providing guidance on compliance validation.
policies.policy_text: All entities that accept, process, store, or transmit credit card information must implement security controls as defined by PCI DSS. Compliance assessments must be conducted by Qualified Security Assessors (QSAs) or through Self-Assessment Questionnaires (SAQs) as applicable. Organizations must ensure that vulnerability scans are performed by Approved Scanning Vendors (ASVs) for Internet-facing environments. Training for Internal Security Assessors (ISAs) must be provided to enhance internal compliance capabilities.
policies.scope: This policy applies to all organizational units involved in payment card processing, including merchants, service providers, and financial institutions. It covers all systems, applications, and infrastructure that handle credit card information, including on-premises, cloud, and mobile environments. The policy also encompasses third-party vendors and partners involved in payment processing and is applicable across all geographic locations where the organization operates.
policies.objective: The objective of this policy is to ensure that all entities comply with PCI DSS requirements through effective security controls and assessment processes. Specific goals include achieving 100% compliance with PCI DSS standards, reducing vulnerabilities in payment processing systems, and enhancing the overall security posture of the organization. The policy aims to protect stakeholders by ensuring that sensitive payment card information is handled securely and in accordance with regulatory requirements.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy outlines the requirements for engaging Qualified Security Assessors (QSAs) to conduct compliance assessments. It specifies the criteria for selecting QSAs and the process for assessment engagement.
subpolicies.control: Organizations must engage a Qualified Security Assessor (QSA) to conduct compliance assessments annually. The QSA must be selected based on their PCI SSC approval status and relevant experience. Assessments should be scheduled at least 30 days in advance, and the organization must provide all necessary documentation and access to systems for the assessment. The assessment results must be documented and reviewed by the organization's compliance team within 14 days of completion.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy provides guidelines for completing the Self-Assessment Questionnaire (SAQ) for organizations that are eligible to self-assess their PCI DSS compliance.
subpolicies.control: Eligible organizations must complete the appropriate Self-Assessment Questionnaire (SAQ) annually. The SAQ must be completed by a designated compliance officer or team within the organization. The completion of the SAQ should occur within 60 days of the end of the fiscal year, and the results must be submitted to the acquiring bank or payment card brand as required. Documentation supporting the SAQ responses must be maintained for a minimum of three years.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy outlines the requirements for conducting vulnerability scans of Internet-facing environments by Approved Scanning Vendors (ASVs).
subpolicies.control: Organizations must engage an Approved Scanning Vendor (ASV) to perform quarterly vulnerability scans of all Internet-facing systems. Scans must be conducted at least once every three months and after any significant changes to the environment. The ASV must provide a detailed report of the scan results, which must be reviewed by the organization's security team within 7 days of receipt. Any identified vulnerabilities must be remediated within 30 days.

policies.policy_description: The Network Security Policy outlines the requirements for building and maintaining a secure network and systems to protect cardholder data. This policy is essential for ensuring compliance with PCI DSS and safeguarding sensitive information from unauthorized access and breaches. It applies to all personnel involved in the management and operation of network infrastructure and systems that handle payment card information.
policies.policy_text: All organizations must implement and maintain a secure network and systems to protect cardholder data. This includes the installation of firewalls, secure configurations for routers and switches, and the use of encryption for data transmission. Regular vulnerability assessments and penetration testing must be conducted to identify and mitigate security risks. Compliance with PCI DSS must be validated through the use of Qualified Security Assessors (QSAs) and Approved Scanning Vendors (ASVs).
policies.scope: This policy applies to all organizational units that manage network infrastructure, including IT departments, security teams, and third-party service providers. It covers all systems, applications, and devices that store, process, or transmit cardholder data, including on-premises, cloud, and mobile environments. The policy also extends to all personnel with access to these systems, including contractors and vendors.
policies.objective: The objective of this policy is to establish a secure network environment that protects cardholder data from unauthorized access and breaches. Specific goals include achieving compliance with PCI DSS requirements, reducing the risk of data breaches, and ensuring operational effectiveness in network security management. The policy aims to protect stakeholders by maintaining the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of payment card information.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy outlines the requirements for configuring and managing firewalls to protect cardholder data. It includes guidelines for establishing firewall rules, monitoring traffic, and maintaining firewall security.
subpolicies.control: WHAT: Implement and maintain firewalls to control incoming and outgoing network traffic. WHO: Network security team is responsible for firewall configuration and management. WHEN: Firewalls must be reviewed and updated at least quarterly or whenever there are significant changes to the network. HOW: Use automated tools for monitoring and logging firewall activity, and conduct regular audits to ensure compliance with established rules. WHERE: This control applies to all network segments that handle cardholder data.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy establishes the requirements for conducting vulnerability assessments and penetration testing to identify and remediate security weaknesses in the network and systems.
subpolicies.control: WHAT: Conduct regular vulnerability scans and penetration tests on all systems that store, process, or transmit cardholder data. WHO: Qualified Security Assessors (QSAs) and internal security teams are responsible for conducting assessments. WHEN: Vulnerability scans must be performed at least quarterly, and penetration tests must be conducted annually or after significant changes to the network. HOW: Utilize approved scanning tools and methodologies to identify vulnerabilities, and document findings in a report for remediation. subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy outlines the requirements for encrypting cardholder data during transmission and storage to prevent unauthorized access and ensure data integrity.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy establishes access control measures to ensure that only authorized personnel can access cardholder data.

policies.policy_description: The Vulnerability Management Program is designed to identify, assess, and mitigate vulnerabilities within the organization's systems that handle payment card information. This policy ensures compliance with PCI DSS requirements and promotes a proactive approach to security by regularly scanning and addressing vulnerabilities. It applies to all systems, applications, and personnel involved in payment card processing.
policies.policy_text: The organization shall maintain a Vulnerability Management Program that includes regular vulnerability scans, timely remediation of identified vulnerabilities, and documentation of all findings and actions taken. The program must be reviewed and updated at least annually or whenever significant changes occur in the environment.
policies.scope: This policy applies to all organizational units that process, store, or transmit payment card information, including IT departments, security teams, and third-party service providers. It encompasses all systems, applications, and infrastructure involved in payment card transactions, including on-premises, cloud, and mobile environments. The policy also covers all personnel who have access to these systems and data.
policies.objective: The objective of this policy is to establish a comprehensive Vulnerability Management Program that effectively identifies and mitigates security vulnerabilities, ensuring compliance with PCI DSS requirements. The program aims to reduce the risk of data breaches, enhance the security posture of the organization, and protect sensitive payment card information. Success will be measured by the timely identification and remediation of vulnerabilities, as well as adherence to PCI DSS compliance standards.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy outlines the procedures for conducting regular vulnerability scans of all Internet-facing systems and applications to identify potential security weaknesses. It includes guidelines for selecting scanning tools, scheduling scans, and reporting results.
subpolicies.control: WHAT: Conduct vulnerability scans on all Internet-facing systems at least quarterly and after any significant changes. WHO: The IT Security Team is responsible for executing the scans. WHEN: Scans must be scheduled quarterly and after major system updates. HOW: Utilize approved scanning tools that comply with PCI DSS requirements to perform the scans. WHERE: Scans must be conducted on all systems that process, store, or transmit payment card information.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy defines the process for remediating identified vulnerabilities, including prioritization based on risk assessment and documentation of remediation efforts.
subpolicies.control: WHAT: Remediate identified vulnerabilities within 30 days of detection, prioritizing based on severity. WHO: The IT Security Team will assess and prioritize vulnerabilities, while system owners are responsible for implementing fixes. WHEN: Remediation actions must be initiated within 24 hours of scan completion and completed within 30 days. HOW: Utilize a risk-based approach to prioritize vulnerabilities and document all remediation efforts in the security incident management system. WHERE: This process applies to all systems and applications involved in payment card processing.

policies.policy_description: This policy establishes the requirements for implementing strong access control measures to protect cardholder data and ensure compliance with PCI DSS. It outlines the responsibilities of personnel in managing access to sensitive systems and data, ensuring that only authorized individuals have access to critical information. The policy aims to mitigate risks associated with unauthorized access and enhance the overall security posture of the organization.
policies.policy_text: All personnel must adhere to the Access Control Policy, which mandates that access to cardholder data and related systems is restricted to authorized users only. Access rights must be granted based on the principle of least privilege, and regular reviews of access permissions must be conducted to ensure compliance. Any unauthorized access attempts must be reported immediately to the security team.
policies.scope: This policy applies to all employees, contractors, and third-party service providers who have access to cardholder data and related systems within the organization. It encompasses all systems, applications, and infrastructure that store, process, or transmit payment card information, including on-premises, cloud, and remote environments.
policies.objective: The objective of this policy is to establish a robust framework for access control that protects cardholder data from unauthorized access. Specific goals include ensuring compliance with PCI DSS requirements, reducing the risk of data breaches, and enhancing operational effectiveness through regular access reviews and audits.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy outlines the procedures for granting, modifying, and revoking user access to systems that handle cardholder data. It includes requirements for user authentication, password management, and access reviews.
subpolicies.control: WHAT: Implement user access management procedures to control access to cardholder data. WHO: The IT Security team is responsible for managing user access. WHEN: Access requests must be processed within 24 hours, and access reviews must be conducted quarterly. HOW: Use role-based access control (RBAC) and maintain an access log for auditing purposes. WHERE: This applies to all systems and applications that store, process, or transmit cardholder data.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy specifies the requirements for user authentication and password management to ensure secure access to sensitive systems.
subpolicies.control: WHAT: Enforce strong password policies and multi-factor authentication (MFA) for all users accessing cardholder data. WHO: All users with access to sensitive systems must comply with these requirements. WHEN: Passwords must be changed every 90 days, and MFA must be implemented for remote access. HOW: Use automated tools to enforce password complexity and expiration policies. WHERE: This applies to all systems that handle cardholder data.

policies.policy_description: This policy establishes the requirements for regularly monitoring and testing networks to ensure compliance with PCI DSS. It is essential for identifying vulnerabilities and ensuring the security of cardholder data. The policy applies to all systems and personnel involved in payment card processing within the organization.
policies.policy_text: All networks that store, process, or transmit cardholder data must be regularly monitored and tested to identify vulnerabilities and ensure compliance with PCI DSS. This includes conducting vulnerability scans, penetration testing, and continuous monitoring of network traffic. All findings must be documented, and remediation actions must be taken promptly.
policies.scope: This policy applies to all organizational units that handle payment card transactions, including IT, security, and compliance teams. It covers all systems, applications, and infrastructure involved in payment processing, including on-premises and cloud environments. The policy also extends to third-party vendors and service providers that interact with cardholder data.
policies.objective: The objective of this policy is to ensure the continuous security of cardholder data by implementing regular monitoring and testing of networks. This includes identifying and mitigating vulnerabilities, ensuring compliance with PCI DSS requirements, and protecting the organization from potential data breaches. Success will be measured by the timely completion of vulnerability assessments and the effectiveness of remediation efforts.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy outlines the procedures for conducting regular vulnerability scans on all Internet-facing systems to identify potential security weaknesses.
subpolicies.control: WHAT: Conduct vulnerability scans on all Internet-facing systems. WHO: IT Security Team is responsible for executing scans. WHEN: Scans must be conducted at least quarterly and after any significant changes to the network. HOW: Utilize an Approved Scanning Vendor (ASV) to perform scans and generate reports. WHERE: Applies to all systems that store, process, or transmit cardholder data.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy defines the requirements for conducting penetration testing to evaluate the security of the network and identify vulnerabilities.
subpolicies.control: WHAT: Perform penetration testing on all critical systems. WHO: Qualified Security Assessors (QSAs) or internal security assessors must conduct the tests. WHEN: Penetration tests must be performed at least annually and after any significant changes to the network. HOW: Follow the guidelines set forth by PCI DSS for penetration testing methodologies. WHERE: Applies to all systems that handle cardholder data.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy establishes the requirements for continuous monitoring of network traffic to detect and respond to security incidents.
subpolicies.control: WHAT: Implement continuous monitoring of network traffic for anomalies. WHO: Security Operations Center (SOC) team is responsible for monitoring. WHEN: Monitoring must be conducted 24/7. HOW: Utilize security information and event management (SIEM) tools to analyze logs and alerts. WHERE: Applies to all network segments that process cardholder data.

framework_info.framework_name: Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS)
framework_info.framework_description: The Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) is a set of security standards designed to ensure that all companies that accept, process, store or transmit credit card information maintain a secure environment. PCI DSS applies to all entities involved in payment card processing including merchants, processors, acquirers, issuers, and service providers.

policies.policy_description: This policy outlines the requirements for maintaining an Information Security Policy that aligns with the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS). It is essential for organizations to establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive security policy to protect cardholder data and ensure compliance with PCI DSS requirements. This policy serves as a framework for security practices and compliance assessments.
policies.policy_text: Organizations must develop, implement, and maintain an Information Security Policy that addresses the security requirements outlined in PCI DSS. This policy must be reviewed at least annually and updated as necessary to reflect changes in business operations, technology, and regulatory requirements. All personnel must be trained on the policy and its implications for their roles in protecting cardholder data.
policies.scope: This policy applies to all organizational units, personnel, systems, applications, and infrastructure that handle cardholder data. It covers all geographic locations where the organization operates, including on-premises, cloud, and remote environments. Third-party vendors and service providers that process, store, or transmit cardholder data are also included in this scope.
policies.objective: The objective of this policy is to establish a robust framework for information security that ensures the protection of cardholder data, compliance with PCI DSS, and the mitigation of risks associated with data breaches. The policy aims to achieve measurable outcomes such as reduced incidents of data breaches, improved compliance scores during assessments, and enhanced awareness of security practices among personnel.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy outlines the requirements for conducting compliance assessments and validations to ensure adherence to PCI DSS. It includes the use of Qualified Security Assessors (QSAs) and Approved Scanning Vendors (ASVs) for external assessments and the Self-Assessment Questionnaire (SAQ) for eligible organizations.
subpolicies.control: Organizations must engage a Qualified Security Assessor (QSA) to conduct an annual compliance assessment. The assessment must be completed within the first quarter of each fiscal year. Additionally, organizations must utilize an Approved Scanning Vendor (ASV) to perform quarterly vulnerability scans of their Internet-facing environments. The results of these assessments and scans must be documented and reviewed by the Information Security Officer (ISO) to ensure compliance and identify areas for improvement.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy mandates the training and awareness programs for all personnel regarding the Information Security Policy and PCI DSS requirements. It ensures that employees understand their roles in protecting cardholder data.
subpolicies.control: All employees must complete PCI DSS training within 30 days of hire and annually thereafter. The training program must include information on the importance of data security, specific PCI DSS requirements, and the organization's Information Security Policy. The Human Resources department is responsible for tracking training completion and ensuring that records are maintained for audit purposes.

policies.policy_title: Compensating Controls for PCI DSS Compliance
policies.policy_description: This policy outlines the requirements for implementing compensating controls to meet PCI DSS compliance when standard requirements cannot be fully met. It emphasizes the importance of maintaining a secure environment for payment card data and provides guidance on acceptable alternative measures. The policy applies to all entities involved in payment card processing, including merchants and service providers.
policies.policy_text: Organizations must implement compensating controls when they cannot meet specific PCI DSS requirements. These controls must be documented, assessed, and approved by a Qualified Security Assessor (QSA) or an Internal Security Assessor (ISA). The compensating controls must provide equivalent or greater security than the original PCI DSS requirement and must be regularly reviewed for effectiveness.
policies.scope: This policy applies to all organizational units involved in payment card processing, including IT, compliance, and security teams. It covers all systems, applications, and infrastructure that handle payment card data, including on-premises, cloud, and mobile environments. The policy also extends to third-party vendors and service providers that interact with payment card information.
policies.objective: The objective of this policy is to ensure that organizations can maintain PCI DSS compliance through the implementation of effective compensating controls. This includes providing measurable outcomes such as reduced risk of data breaches, maintaining customer trust, and ensuring ongoing compliance with PCI DSS requirements. The policy aims to facilitate a secure environment for payment card transactions while allowing flexibility in compliance approaches.

subpolicies.subpolicy_title: Assessment and Approval of Compensating Controls
subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy outlines the process for assessing and approving compensating controls that organizations implement to meet PCI DSS requirements. It includes criteria for evaluating the effectiveness of these controls and the roles responsible for the assessment.
subpolicies.control: Organizations must assess compensating controls by identifying the specific PCI DSS requirement that cannot be met (WHAT), assigning the responsibility to the compliance team (WHO), conducting the assessment annually or upon significant changes (WHEN), using established evaluation criteria and documentation processes (HOW), and ensuring that all assessments are documented and stored in a secure location accessible to relevant stakeholders (WHERE).

subpolicies.subpolicy_title: Documentation and Review of Compensating Controls
subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy mandates the documentation of all compensating controls implemented and the regular review process to ensure their continued effectiveness and compliance with PCI DSS.
subpolicies.control: Organizations must document all compensating controls implemented (WHAT), assign the responsibility to the security team (WHO), review the documentation bi-annually or after any significant changes (WHEN), utilize a standardized documentation template and review checklist (HOW), and maintain these documents in a secure repository accessible to compliance and audit teams (WHERE).

It encompasses all systems, applications, and infrastructure that handle cardholder data, including on-premises, cloud, and mobile environments. The policy is applicable across all geographic locations where the organization operates.
policies.objective: The objective of this policy is to ensure that all relevant entities maintain compliance with PCI DSS requirements, thereby safeguarding cardholder data and reducing the risk of data breaches. Specific goals include achieving a minimum compliance score of 95% during assessments, ensuring all vulnerability scans are conducted quarterly, and providing training for all personnel involved in compliance activities.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy details the requirements for engaging Qualified Security Assessors to conduct formal PCI DSS compliance assessments.
subpolicies.control: Organizations must engage a Qualified Security Assessor (QSA) approved by the PCI Security Standards Council to perform compliance assessments. The engagement must occur annually, with the QSA providing a detailed report of findings and recommendations. The organization must ensure that the QSA has the necessary expertise and credentials to assess the specific business environment. The assessment must be documented and retained for a minimum of three years.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy outlines the requirements for utilizing Approved Scanning Vendors to perform vulnerability scans.
subpolicies.control: Organizations must engage an Approved Scanning Vendor (ASV) to conduct vulnerability scans of their Internet-facing environments at least quarterly. The ASV must provide a detailed report of vulnerabilities identified, including remediation recommendations. The organization is responsible for addressing all identified vulnerabilities within 30 days of the scan. Documentation of the scans and remediation efforts must be maintained for a minimum of three years.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: This subpolicy specifies the requirements for completing the Self-Assessment Questionnaire for eligible organizations.
subpolicies.control: Eligible organizations must complete the appropriate Self-Assessment Questionnaire (SAQ) annually. The SAQ must be submitted to the acquiring financial institution or payment card brand for validation. Organizations must determine the correct SAQ type based on their business environment and processing methods. Documentation of the completed SAQ must be retained for a minimum of three years.
